[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Research[ENDCOLOR] converts 25% of the [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production of this City into [ICON_RESEARCH] Science.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Wealth[ENDCOLOR] converts 25% of the [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production of this City into [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
No Production
The City-State of {1_CivName:textkey} has a Message.
You have met the City-State of {1_CivName:textkey}.
They are Neutral.
You are Friends.
You are Allies.
You are at War.
They hate you.
You currently have {1_Num} [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence with {2_CityStateName:textkey}. {3_DetailString}

{1_Num} is required to become [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]FRIENDS[ENDCOLOR]. Once Friends, you may pass through their borders without consequence. You also receive a bonus relating to this City-State's specialty.

{1_Num} is required to become [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]ALLIES[ENDCOLOR]. As Allies, {2_CityStateName:textkey} will donate all of its Resources to you. You also receive an additional bonus relating to this City-State's specialty.
More will not confer greater benefits, but will make it harder for other major powers to become the most favored nation of this City-State.
While at war this value is locked at its present level.
You are either at war with this City-State's ally, or you have attacked so many City-States that none of them will ever deal with you again!

Greetings great leader. We represent {1_CivName:textkey}. We earnestly hope that we can forge a strong and lasting peace with your mighty empire. {2_DetailsString} We trust that you will lend us assistance should we call upon you in the future.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{3_GiftString}[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{4_SpeakAgainString}

Greetings. We are the people of {1_CivName:textkey}. Treat us fairly and we shall have peace. {2_DetailsString} We seek mutually supportive relations with our neighbors: if we call upon you for assistance we hope that you will provide it, and of course we shall do the same for you.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{3_GiftString}[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{4_SpeakAgainString}

Halt, Stranger! We are the mighty people of {1_CivName:textkey}. Trifle with us at your peril! {2_DetailsString} If you earn the privilege. We are of course self-sufficient but if we ask for assistance we expect you to provide it promptly.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{3_GiftString}[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{4_SpeakAgainString}

Ahhhh... An omen told {1_CivName:textkey} that you would one day arrive. {2_DetailsString} We shall do great things together - your empire and ours. We have seen it in the stars![NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{3_GiftString}[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{4_SpeakAgainString}
(If you wish to speak with {1_CivName:textkey} again you may click on their City.)
We are a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Cultured[ENDCOLOR] people and we can help improve your [ICON_CULTURE] [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Culture[ENDCOLOR].
We are a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Militaristic[ENDCOLOR] people and we can increase the strength of your [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Army[ENDCOLOR].
We are a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Maritime[ENDCOLOR] people and we can help accelerate your civilization's [ICON_FOOD] [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Growth[ENDCOLOR].
Greetings great leader. What brings you to our court today?
Hello again. What are you here to discuss?
What business do you have here?
Ahhh, it's you again... excellent.
We are glad to see the return of peace.
We hope that you have come to end this conflict.
We have no business with bloodthirsty tyrants such as yourself. Begone.
We ask your assistance in our battle against the evil forces of {1_PlayerNames}.
They want you to go to war with {1_PlayerNames}.
Sadly, we remain plagued by Barbarians.
It would greatly benefit both of our civilizations if you constructed a Road between our [ICON_CAPITAL] Capitals.
They want a Road constructed between our [ICON_CAPITAL] Capitals.
There's still that Barbarian Encampment nearby that we'd like someone to take care of.
They want a nearby Barbarian Encampment destroyed.
If you can find a source of {1_ResourceName:textkey} and connect it to your trade network it will make our merchants very happy.
They want you to connect {1_ResourceName:textkey} to your trade network.
If you are able to build {1_WonderName:textkey} our scholars and artists will be in awe of your accomplishments.
They want you to build {1_WonderName:textkey}.
We seek the wisdom of a {1_UnitName:textkey}. We would be delighted if you could attract one to your lands.
They want you to generate a {1_UnitName:textkey}.
Our dispute with {1_CityStateName:textkey} remains an issue. If you could ... take care of them, we would make it worth your while.
They want you to destroy the City-State of {1_CityStateName:textkey}.
We are still in search of new trade routes to {1_CivName:textkey}. Perhaps you can assist us.
They want you to find the lands of {1_CivName:textkey}.
We still yearn to discover more of the Natural Wonders of this world.
They want you to discover a Natural Wonder.
One more request.
We are appreciative of your dedication. Let us hope that your pledge is ultimately unnecessary.
If that's what you want to worry about, we won't stop you. We can take care of ourselves though.
Resume Unit Spawning
Stop Unit Spawning

Pledging to protect a City State lets the other major powers in the game know that you will protect the City-State should it be attacked. This may deter attacks upon it by players who don't want to risk a conflict with you.
Clicking this will tell the Militaristic City State to either stop or resume gifting Units to you.
You may spend [ICON_GOLD] Gold to improve your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence with this City-State.

You may gift this City-State a unit from anywhere on the map (it will disappear and arrive in 3 turns). The first few times this is done it will earn you a small amount of [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence. You may not gift non-combat units.
Make Peace
Provide Gift of [ICON_GOLD] Gold

Over time, the amount of [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence earned from gifts of [ICON_GOLD] Gold goes down. Additionally, the more Gold you give in a single gift, the more Influence is earned - making larger gifts is more efficient!
{1_Num} [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence is needed to be Friends, and {2_Num} is needed to be Allies. You currently have {3_Num} [ICON_INFLUENCE].
Gift a Unit
Declare War
Pledge to Protect
Stop Unit Spawning
You have met the City-State of {1_CivName:textkey}.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{2_GiftString}[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{3_SpeakAgainString}
Nobody
A befriended [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Cultured[ENDCOLOR] City-State will provide you gifts of [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, allowing you to obtain Social Policies more quickly.

A befriended [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Militaristic[ENDCOLOR] City-State will provide you occasional gifts of advanced military units. They will also make requests that are more militaristic in nature (e.g. destroying a Barbarian Encampment, or capturing a neighboring City-State).
A befriended [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Maritime[ENDCOLOR] City-State will boost the [ICON_FOOD] Food of your [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital when Friends, and all of your cities when Allies.
A befriended [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Friendly[ENDCOLOR] City-State will usually make requests that require some peaceful action, like building a Wonder or constructing a Road to them.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Neutral[ENDCOLOR] City-States are fairly even-keel, and try to mind their own business.
[ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence with a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Hostile[ENDCOLOR] City-State drops more quickly than normal. They will also make requests to capture neighboring City-States more often.
Compared with other City-States, an [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Irrational[ENDCOLOR] City-State is more random with the requests it makes.

If a player becomes the Ally of a City-State, they receive extra bonuses relating to that City-State's trait, and they will also receive any luxury and strategic Resources the City-State has connected.
If a player becomes the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Ally[ENDCOLOR] of this City-State, these are the nearby Resources which the player will receive once the City-State has connected them.
You are the first great empire they have met, so they provide you a gift of [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_NumGold} [ICON_GOLD] Gold[ENDCOLOR].
They provide you with a gift of [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_NumGold} [ICON_GOLD] Gold[ENDCOLOR].

Allies
You are [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Allies[ENDCOLOR] with {1_CityStateName:textkey}. Each turn, your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence with them will change by {2_Num}.
Friends
You are [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Friends[ENDCOLOR] with {1_CityStateName:textkey}. Each turn, your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence with them will change by {2_Num}.
Because you are at least Friends, you are allowed to freely pass through their borders.
Because of your leader's special trait, you are allowed to freely pass through their borders.
You are receiving [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_Num} [ICON_CULTURE] Culture[ENDCOLOR] per turn from them.

You are receiving [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_Num} [ICON_FOOD] Food[ENDCOLOR] per turn in your [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital, and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_Num} [ICON_FOOD] Food[ENDCOLOR] in all your other Cities.
You will receive a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]new military unit[ENDCOLOR] from them approximately every {1_Num} turns.
You are receiving [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_Num} [ICON_RESEARCH] Science[ENDCOLOR] per turn from them.
They are granting you {1_ResourcesStringSeparatedByCommas}.
Permanent War
You have attacked so many City-States that {1_CityStateName:textkey} will never make peace with you!
Peace Blocked

Emotionless
War

WAR DECLARED!

You are at war with {1_CityStateName:textkey}. Unless they are allied with another player you are at war with, you may make peace at any time. While at war, your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence is locked at -60.
Angry

You have done something to anger {1_CityStateName:textkey}. Perhaps walking through their borders, or going to war recently.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence with them recovers {2_Num} per turn. You may provide them a gift of [ICON_GOLD] Gold to speed things along.
{1_CityStateName:textkey} neither likes nor dislikes you. If you have enough [ICON_GOLD] Gold, you may provide it a gift to increase your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence.
{1_PlayerName} has made a Declaration of Friendship with {2_PlayerName}
{1_PlayerName} and {2_PlayerName} declare Friendship!
{1_PlayerName} has publicly Denounced {2_PlayerName}
{1_PlayerName} Denounced {2_PlayerName}!
{1_PlayerName} has publicly Denounced us!
Denounced by {1_PlayerName}!
The City of {1_CityName:textkey} is starving! If it runs out of stored [ICON_FOOD] Food, a [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizen will die!
{1_CityName:textkey} is Starving!
A Unit was disbanded because your empire is running a negative budget and has no treasury!
Unit Disbanded!
Your treasury is empty and your economy is now producing 0 [ICON_GOLD] Gold per turn or less! If the empire reaches {1_Num} GPT some of your units will be forced to disband!
Losing Gold!
{1_PlayerName} has entered the {2_EraString:textkey}!
Your Research Agreement with {1_CivName:textkey} is now completed, and grants you a technology boost!
Research Agreement Complete!
Your Research Agreement with {1_CivName:textkey} has been cancelled because you are now at war.
Research Agreement Cancelled!
You are currently using more {1_Resource:textkey} than you have! All units which require it will [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]fight much less effectively[ENDCOLOR].
You Need {1_Resource:textkey}!
Your acquisition of {1_Resource:textkey} causes the city of {2_CityName:textkey} to enter "We Love the King Day", giving the city a [ICON_FOOD] growth bonus!
{1_CityName:textkey} loves the king!

The City of {1_CityName:textkey} wants {2_ResourceName:textkey}! Connecting that resource to your trade network will cause the city to enter "We Love the King Day," increasing its [ICON_FOOD] growth rate!
{1_CityName:textkey} demands {2_ResourceName:textkey}!
{2_ResourceName:textkey} is now available in {1_CityName:textkey}! This increases [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production when building Wonders in this city by {3_Num}%!
{1_CityName:textkey} has {2_ResourceName:textkey}!
The City of {1_CityName:textkey} can attack a nearby enemy!
{1_CityName:textkey} can fire upon an enemy!

{1_CivName:textkey} is recognized as the civilization with the most Great People, earning {1_CivName:textkey} {2_Num} Civilization Points. Another player will need at least {3_Num} Great People to win this title.
An unmet civilization has the most Great People in the world! This title provides {1_Num} Civilization Points. Another player will need at least {2_Num} Great People to win this title.
Your civilization has the most Great People in the entire world, earning you {1_Num} Civilization Points! Another player will need at least {2_Num} Great People to take this title away from you.
{1_CivName:textkey} is honored as the civilization with the most Social Policies, earning {2_Num} Civilization Points. Another player will need at least {3_Num} Social Policies to win this title.
An unmet player is now honored as the civilization with the most Social Policies, earning {1_Num} Civilization Points. Another player will need at least {2_Num} Social Policies to claim this title.
Your civilization has the most Social Policies in the world, earning you {1_Num} Civilization Points! Another player will need at least {2_Num} Social Policies to take this title from you.
{1_CivName:textkey} is recognized as the civilization with the most World Wonders, earning {2_Num} Civilization Points. Another player will need at least {3_Num} World Wonders to claim this title.
An unmet civilization now possesses the most World Wonders, earning {1_Num} Civilization Points! Another player will need at least {2_Num} World Wonders to take this title.
Your civilization now possesses the most World Wonders, earning {1_Num} Civilization Points! Another player will need at least {2_Num} World Wonders to take this title.
The City of {1_CityName:textkey} has built up enough Culture to claim a new Tile!

The City of {1_CityName:textkey} now has {2_Population} [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens! The new Citizen will automatically work the land near the City for additional [ICON_FOOD] Food, [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production or [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Our Defensive Pact with {1_CivName:textkey} has ended.
A deal where {1_CivName:textkey} had a Defensive Pact with us has ended.
A deal where we provided Gold every turn to {1_CivName:textkey} has ended.
A deal where {1_CivName:textkey} provided Gold every turn to us has ended.
A deal where we provided Open Borders to {1_CivName:textkey} has ended.
A deal where {1_CivName:textkey} provided us Opened Borders has ended.
Our Research Agreement with {1_CivName:textkey} has ended.
A deal where {1_CivName:textkey} had a Research Agreement with us has ended.
A deal where we provided {2_Resource} to {1_CivName:textkey} has ended.
A deal where {1_CivName:textkey} provided {2_Resource} to us has ended.
Our Trade Agreement with {1_CivName:textkey} has ended.
A deal where {1_CivName:textkey} had a Trade Agreement with us has ended.
A peace treaty with {1_CivName:textkey} has ended. Either civilization may now declare war on the other.
Peace Treaty Expired
You have accumulated enough Culture to adopt a new Social Policy!
You have accumulated enough Culture to adopt a new Social Policy![NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Right-Click to dismiss without choosing.
You may choose a free Social Policy!
Free Social Policy!
You have accumulated enough Gold to purchase a new Tile in one of your Cities!
You have gained {1_Num} Civilization Point for advancing to a new Era!
A Barbarian Encampment has been discovered! It will create Barbarian units until dispersed!
The barbarians in this Encampment have joined your army and given you [ICON_GOLD]!
A barbarian naval unit has joined your forces and given you [ICON_GOLD]!
You have discovered Ancient Ruins! Sending a Unit into the Ruins may uncover hidden secrets!
You have discovered {@2_NaturalWonder}! You have {1_Num} Natural Wonders still to find.
You have discovered a source of {1_ResourceName:textkey}!
No room for new unit!
{1_CityName:textkey} tried to place {2_UnitName:textkey}, but there was no tile for it to move into.
You have killed a group of Barbarians near {1_CivName:textkey}! They are grateful, and your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence with them has increased by 12!
Barbarian killed near {1_CivName:textkey}!
You have met the City-State of {1_CivName:textkey}!
You are trespassing in the lands of {1_CivName:textkey}! As long as you have Units in their territory, [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence with them will decrease!
You have liberated {1_CivName:textkey}! They are indebted to you for their survival.
{1_MinorCivName:textkey} has been liberated by {2_MajorCivName:textkey}!

Your aggression against your weaker neighbors has not gone unnoticed. They have begun banding together for mutual defense, and will fight to the death. Should you continue attacking City-States, more will join the alliance.
City-States Grow Worried
Your pattern of preying upon the City-States of the world has caused a great deal of alarm. The alliance to thwart you continues to grow.
City-States Become Hostile

Because {1_NameKey:textkey} has shown continued aggression, several of the City-States of the world are banding together to fight this common foe! Any military support you can provide would be very welcome. (Click on one of their Cities to give them Units.)
City-States Unite Against {1_NameKey:textkey}
Many of the City-States of the world remain at war with {1_NameKey:textkey}. They welcome assistance in any form, particularly military Units. (Click on one of their Cities to give them Units.)
City-States Request Assistance
Because you've entered a new era, the bonuses you receive from some City-States have increased in value!
City-State Bonuses Changed!

{1_CivName:textkey} is under attack from {2_CivName:textkey}! If you don't help them they might be wiped out. They've requested the help of all major powers. If you are able to kill at least {3_NumUnits} enemy Units, {1_CivName:textkey} will be indebted to you.
{1_CivName:textkey} attacked by {2_CivName:textkey}!
You have fulfilled {1_CivName:textkey} request to weaken their vile enemy, {2_CivName:textkey}! Your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence with them has grown.
{1_CivName:textkey} War complete

{1_CivName:textkey} is looking for assistance against {2_CivName:textkey}. While they would prefer your active participation in the war, you may also help them by secretly giving them military Units. (Click on their City to do this.)
{1_CivName:textkey} requests Units
{1_CivName:textkey} no longer needs your assistance against {2_CivName:textkey}.
{1_CivName:textkey} no longer at War
{1_CivName:textkey} requests your assistance against invading Barbarians! Each Barbarian you kill will earn you [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence over the City-State.
{1_CivName:textkey} under attack!
{1_CivName:textkey} no longer needs your assistance against the Barbarians.
{1_CivName:textkey} cancels request
{1_CivName:textkey} would like you to construct a Road between your [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital and theirs!
{1_CivName:textkey} requests a Road
You have successfully [ICON_CONNECTED] connected your [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital with {1_CivName:textkey}! Your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence with them has grown.
Road to {1_CivName:textkey}
The citizens of {1_CivName:textkey} have become uneasy at the presence of a nearby Barbarian Encampment, and they'd like someone to destroy it. They will amply reward whoever accomplishes this.
{1_CivName:textkey} Targets Nearby Encampment
You have successfully destroyed the Barbarian Encampment as requested by {1_CivName:textkey}! Your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence over them has increased.
Encampment Cleared for {1_CivName:textkey}!
The Barbarian Encampment {1_MinorName:textkey} wanted you to eliminate has been destroyed by someone else!
{1_MinorName:textkey} No Longer Needs Your Help

The merchants of {@2_CivName} seek new riches. They have heard rumors of {@1_ResourceName} and {@1_ResourceName: plural 1?its; other?their;} great value. You will be rewarded if you are able to connect this resource to your trade network.
{@2_CivName} desires {@1_ResourceName}
As {@2_CivName} requested, you have successfully connected {@1_ResourceName} to your trade network! Their merchants are pleased, and your level of [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence with them has increased.
{@1_ResourceName} Connected for {@2_CivName}!

The cultural elite of {@2_CivName} yearn for something to dazzle them. They believe if {@1_WonderName} is built it will lead to great enlightenment. Should you be the one to accomplish this they will see to it that you are amply rewarded.
{@2_CivName} desires {@1_WonderName}
As {@2_CivName} requested, you have successfully constructed {@1_WonderName}! Your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence with them has increased.
{@1_WonderName} Constructed for {@2_CivName}!
Another player has constructed {@1_WonderName}, meaning you can no longer fulfill the request of {@2_CivName}.
Can no longer Construct {@1_WonderName} for {@2_CivName}!

{2_CivName:textkey} has had a serious dispute with {1_TargetName:textkey}. {2_CivName:textkey} is now looking for a major power willing to help resolve the issue by destroying their foe. Anyone willing to take up this offer will be handsomely rewarded.
{2_CivName:textkey} wants {1_TargetName:textkey} eliminated.
Much to the delight of {2_CivName:textkey}, you have eliminated {1_TargetName:textkey}! They are extremely grateful for your assistance in this matter.
{1_TargetName:textkey} Eliminated for {2_CivName:textkey}!
Another player has destroyed {1_TargetName:textkey}, preventing you from fulfilling the request of {2_CivName:textkey}.
Can no longer eliminate {1_TargetName:textkey} for {2_CivName:textkey}
The scholars of {2_CivName:textkey} seek the wisdom of a {1_UnitName}. If you are able to attract one to your empire they shall reward you.
{2_CivName:textkey} Seeks a {1_UnitName}
As {2_CivName:textkey} requested, you have successfully created a {1_UnitName}! Their scholars are in awe, and your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence over them has increased.
{2_CivName:textkey} Recognizes Your {1_UnitName}!

{2_CivName:textkey} is looking for new trade opportunities. They have heard of a distant empire named "{1_TargetName:textkey}." If you are able to find territory belonging to {1_TargetName:textkey} you will be rewarded.
{2_CivName:textkey} seeks {1_TargetName:textkey}
Your discovery of {1_TargetName:textkey} has greatly pleased the merchants of {2_CivName:textkey}. Your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence over them has increased.
{1_TargetName:textkey} Discovered for {2_CivName:textkey}!
Well-to-do citizens of {1_CivName:textkey} have heard rumors that there are incredible Natural Wonders in the world which remain undiscovered. They hope that someone can investigate this claim.
{1_CivName:textkey} seeks a new Natural Wonder
Your discovery of a new Natural Wonder has inspired the citizens of {1_CivName:textkey}! Because of your efforts, your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence over them has increased.
Natural Wonder discovered for {1_CivName:textkey}!
The City-State of {1_CivName:textkey} has given you a new Unit!
New Unit from {1_CivName:textkey}!
{1_MinorName:textkey} has a new Ally!
{1_NewCivName:textkey} has replaced {2_OldCivName:textkey} as the Ally of {3_MinorName:textkey}!
{1_NewCivName:textkey} is now the Ally of {2_MinorName:textkey}.
{1_MinorName:textkey} and {2_NewCivName:textkey} no longer Allies!
{@1_NewCivName} {@1_NewCivName: plural 1?is; 2?are;} no longer the Ally of {@2_MinorName}!
{1_MajorCivName:textkey}: [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence over {2_MinorName:textkey} has increased: they are now Allies!
{1_MinorName:textkey} and {2_NewCivName:textkey} now Allies!
{1_MajorCivName:textkey}: [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence over {2_MinorName:textkey} has decreased. They are no longer Allies and are now Friends.
{1_MinorName:textkey} and {2_NewCivName:textkey} Friends
{1_MajorCivName:textkey}: [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence over {2_MinorName:textkey} has increased: they are now Friends.
{1_MajorCivName:textkey}: [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence over {2_MinorName:textkey} has decreased and they are no longer Friends!
{1_MinorName:textkey} and {2_NewCivName:textkey} not Friends!

[ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence over {1_CivName:textkey} has increased to the point where you are now [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]FRIENDS[ENDCOLOR].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{2_DetailsString} They have also given you permission to move Units through their territory.
As a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Cultural[ENDCOLOR] City-State, they give you rare works of art! (+{1_NumCulture} [ICON_CULTURE] Culture per turn)
As a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Militaristic[ENDCOLOR] City-State, they will occasionally give you military Units.

As a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Maritime[ENDCOLOR] City-State, they will export Food to your empire (+{1_NumCapitalFood}[ICON_FOOD]in [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital, +{2_NumCitiesFood}[ICON_FOOD]in all other Cities).

[ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence over {1_CivName:textkey} has decreased to the point where you are no longer [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]FRIENDS[ENDCOLOR]...[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{2_DetailsString} Also, your Units no longer have permission to move through their territory.
({1_NumCulture} [ICON_CULTURE] Culture per turn lost)
They will no longer give you military Units.
({1_NumCapitalFood}[ICON_FOOD]in [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital, {2_NumCitiesFood}[ICON_FOOD]in all other Cities)

[ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence over {2_MinorCivName:textkey} has increased to the point where you are now their [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]ALLY[ENDCOLOR].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{3_DetailsString}[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{1_ResourceDetailsString}

[ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence over {3_MinorCivName:textkey} has increased to the point where you have [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Supplanted {1_CivName:textkey} as their ALLY[ENDCOLOR].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{4_DetailsString}[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{2_ResourceDetailsString}
As a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Cultural[ENDCOLOR] City-State, they give you their finest cultural artifacts! (+{1_NumCulture} [ICON_CULTURE] Culture per turn)
As a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Militaristic[ENDCOLOR] City-State, they will regularly give you military Units.

As a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Maritime[ENDCOLOR] City-State, they now make large Food exports to your empire (additional +{1_NumCapitalFood}[ICON_FOOD]in [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital, +{2_NumCitiesFood}[ICON_FOOD]in all other Cities).

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Liberty[ENDCOLOR] is best for civilizations which desire rapid expansion.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adopting Liberty will provide 1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture in every city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adopting all policies in the Liberty tree will grant a free Great Person of your choice near the [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Tradition[ENDCOLOR] is best for small empires.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adopting Tradition greatly increases the rate of border expansion in cities and also grants 3 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture in the [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adopting all Policies in the Tradition tree will grant +15% [ICON_FOOD] Growth and +2 [ICON_FOOD] in each city.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Honor[ENDCOLOR] improves the effectiveness of one's army in a variety of ways.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adopting Honor gives a +25% combat bonus VS Barbarians, and notifications will be provided when new Barbarian Encampments spawn in revealed territory. Gain [ICON_CULTURE] Culture for the empire from each barbarian killed.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adopting all policies in the Honor tree will grant [ICON_GOLD] Gold for each enemy unit killed.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Piety[ENDCOLOR] increases the [ICON_CULTURE] Culture of empires.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adopting Piety reduces the time to build [ICON_CULTURE] Culture buildings by 15%.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adopting all policies in the Piety tree will reduce the [ICON_CULTURE] Culture cost of future Policies by 10%.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]This branch cannot be active at the same time as Rationalism.[ENDCOLOR]

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Patronage[ENDCOLOR] enhances the benefits of City-State friendship.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence with City-States degrades 25% slower than normal.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adopting all policies in the Patronage tree will make other players' [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence with City-States decrease 33% more per turn than usual.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Commerce[ENDCOLOR] provides bonuses to naval empires, and those focused on [ICON_GOLD] Gold.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adopting Commerce will boost [ICON_GOLD] Gold output in [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital City by 25%.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adopting all Policies in the Commerce tree will grant +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold from every Specialist.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Rationalism[ENDCOLOR] improves the ability to use and generate [ICON_RESEARCH] Science.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adopting Rationalism boosts [ICON_RESEARCH] Science gained from research agreements by 50%.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adopting all Policies in the Rationalism tree will grant +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold from [ICON_RESEARCH] Science buildings.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]This branch cannot be active at the same time as Piety.[ENDCOLOR]

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Freedom[ENDCOLOR] is best for small, focused empires. In particular, it provides bonuses for [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Great People and Specialists.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Upon adopting Freedom, the rate at which [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Great People are born is increased by 25%.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adopting all Policies in the Freedom tree will increase the base yield from Great Tile Improvements by 100% and length of [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Ages increased by 50%.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]This branch cannot be active at the same time as Autocracy or Order.[ENDCOLOR]

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Order[ENDCOLOR] is best for large, sprawling empires, increasing the strength of the empire based on the number of Cities it contains.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adopting Order will increase [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness by +1 per City.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adopting all Policies in the Order tree will grant +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food, [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, [ICON_RESEARCH] Science, [ICON_GOLD] Gold, and [ICON_CULTURE] Culture per city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]This branch cannot be active at the same time as Freedom or Autocracy.[ENDCOLOR]

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Autocracy[ENDCOLOR] is for militaristic civilizations, dreaming of world conquest.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adopting Autocracy reduces Unit [ICON_GOLD] Gold Maintenance costs by 33%, allowing an empire to field a larger military.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adopting all Policies in the Autocracy tree will grant a 20% attack bonus to all Military Units for 30 turns.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]This branch cannot be active at the same time as Freedom or Order.[ENDCOLOR]

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Collective Rule[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Speeds the training of [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Settlers[ENDCOLOR] by 50% in the [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital and a free Settler appears near the [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Citizenship[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Tile improvement construction rate increased by 25% and a Worker appears near the [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Republic[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production in every City and +5% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production in cities when constructing Buildings.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Representation[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Each city you found will increase the [ICON_CULTURE] Culture cost of policies by 33% less than normal. Also starts a [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Meritocracy[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness for each City you own [ICON_CONNECTED] connected to the [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital and -5% [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness from [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens in non-occupied Cities.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Aristocracy[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+15% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production when building Wonders and +1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness for every 10 [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens in a City.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Oligarchy[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Garrisoned units cost no maintenance and cities with a garrison gain +100% [ICON_RANGE_STRENGTH] Ranged Combat Strength.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Legalism[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Provides a free culture building in your first 4 cities.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Landed Elite[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+10% [ICON_FOOD] Growth and +2 [ICON_FOOD] Food in the [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Monarchy[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold and -1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness for every 2 [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens in the [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Warrior Code[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+15% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production when training Melee units and a Great General appears outside the [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Discipline[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+10% [ICON_STRENGTH] combat strength for military Units which have another military Unit in an adjacent tile.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Military Tradition[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Military Units gain 50% more Experience from combat.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Military Caste[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Each City with a garrison increases empire [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness by 1 and [ICON_CULTURE] Culture by 2.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Professional Army[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_GOLD] Gold cost of upgrading Military Units reduced by 33% and +1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness from every defensive building (Walls, Castle, Arsenal, Military Base).
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Organized Religion[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness from every Monument, Temple and Monastery.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Mandate of Heaven[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]50% of excess [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness added each turn to the amount of [ICON_CULTURE] Culture that may be spent on Social Policies.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Theocracy[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Temples increase a city's [ICON_GOLD] Gold output by 10%.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Reformation[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_CULTURE] Culture increased by 33% in all cities which have built a World Wonder and the empire immediately enters a [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Free Religion[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture for each Monument, Temple and Monastery. Also gives 1 free Policy.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Philanthropy[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_GOLD] Gold gifts to City-States produce 25% more [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Aesthetics[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Minimum [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence level with all City-States is 20.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Scholasticism[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]All City-States which are [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Allies[ENDCOLOR] provide a [ICON_RESEARCH] Science bonus equal to 25% of what they produce for themselves.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Cultural Diplomacy[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Quantity of Resources gifted by City-States increased by 100%. [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness from gifted Luxuries increased by 50%.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Educated Elite[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Allied City-States will occasionally gift you [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Great People.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Trade Unions[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_GOLD] Maintenance paid on Roads and Railroads reduced by 33%. Harbors and Seaports gain +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Merchant Navy[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+3 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production in all coastal Cities.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Mercantilism[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Purchasing items in Cities requires 25% less [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Naval Tradition[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_MOVES] Movement for Naval units and +1 Sight for Naval combat units.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Protectionism[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness from each Luxury resource.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Secularism[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science from every Specialist.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Sovereignty[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+15% [ICON_RESEARCH] Science while the empire is [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happy.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Free Thought[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science from every Trading Post and +17% [ICON_RESEARCH] Science from Universities.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Humanism[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness from every University, Observatory and Public School.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Scientific Revolution[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]2 free Technologies.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Constitution[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture from each World Wonder.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Universal Suffrage[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength of Cities increased by 33%.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Civil Society[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Specialists consume only half the normal amount of [ICON_FOOD] Food.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Free Speech[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]8 units are maintenance free.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Democracy[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Specialist Population in Cities produce half the normal amount of [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]United Front[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Militaristic city states grant units twice as often when you are at war with a common foe.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Socialism[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_GOLD] Gold maintenance costs of Buildings reduced by 15%.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Nationalism[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]15% attack bonus when fighting in friendly territory.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Planned Economy[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Factories increase a city's [ICON_RESEARCH] Science output by 25%.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Communism[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production per City and +10% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production when constructing Buildings.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Populism[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Wounded Military Units inflict 25% more damage than normal.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Militarism[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_GOLD] Gold cost of purchasing units reduced by 33%.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Fascism[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]Quantity of Strategic Resources produced by the empire increased by 100%.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Police State[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+3 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness from every Courthouse. Build Courthouses in half the usual time.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Total War[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE]+15% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production when building Military Units and new Military Units start with +15 Experience.

Augustus Caesar
I found Rome a city of bricks and left it a city of marble.
Hammurabi
When Marduk sent me to rule over men, to give the protection of right to the land, I did right and righteousness, and brought about the well-being of the oppressed.
Abraham Lincoln
Always bear in mind that your own resolution to succeed is more important than any other.
Charlemagne
Let my armies be the rocks and the trees, and the birds in the sky.
Winston Churchill
A pessimist sees the difficulty in every opportunity; an optimist sees the opportunity in every difficulty.
Nelson Mandela
It always seems impossible until it's done.
Marcus Aurelius
Because a thing seems difficult for you, do not think it impossible for anyone to accomplish.
Joan of Arc
I am not afraid... I was born to do this.
Charles de Gaulle
Faced with crisis, the man of character falls back on himself. He imposes his own stamp of action, takes responsibility for it, makes it his own.
Simon Bolivar
Judgement comes from experience, and experience comes from bad judgement.
Lech Walesa
He who puts out his hand to stop the wheel of history will have his fingers crushed.
Ivan the Terrible
Withal, I concern myself greatly regarding the affairs of state, constant wars against hostile nations, and the welfare of my poor people.
Henry VIII
My Lord, if it were not to satisfy the world, and my Realm, I would not do that I must do this day for none earthly thing.
Herbert Hoover
Blessed are the young for they shall inherit the national debt.
Louis XVI
Listeners never hear any good of themselves.
Neville Chamberlain
In war, whichever side may call itself the victor, there are no winners, but all are losers.
Andrew Jackson
There is no pleasure in having nothing to do; the fun is having lots to do and not doing it.
Nero
So great an artist, I die!
Warren G. Harding
Somewhere there must be a book that tells all about it, where I could go to straighten it out in my mind. But I don't know where the book is, and maybe I couldn't read it if I found it.
Ethelred the Unready
Yeah, just five minutes, all right?
Dan Quayle
If we don't succeed, we run the risk of failure.
